questions: How does one make a commit
answers: This is a simple bot designed to help answer your questions. Im currently on my first version (v0.0.1), feel free to ask me anything!
This bot was created and developed by Brendan Dileo as part of a personal project using Python.
I'm an AI bot created to assist with various questions and provide helpful information based on predefined rules.
I process your questions and respond based on a set of rules and data I've been trained on.
Git is a distributed version control system that helps track changes in your files and facilitates collaboration in software development.
GitHub is a web-based platform where developers can host Git repositories, collaborate with others, and manage software projects.
To make a commit in Git, you use the command git commit -m 'your message' after staging your changes with git add. This captures the changes and adds them to your project's history.
Yes, you can create a repository by using the command git init to initialize a new repository in your project directory, or by creating one on GitHub or any other Git hosting service.
A Git branch is a separate line of development that allows you to work on different features or fixes without affecting the main codebase (often called main or master)
A push is when you upload your local changes to a remote Git repository. A pull is when you fetch and merge changes from a remote repository to your local copy.
